fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

request to exclude a certain group from project permissions. The user wants to add any logged in user permission and would like to exclude only a certain set of the user from the "browse project permission"

 

Currently, we only have the option to include a certain group of users but the option to exclude is not available 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User added any logged-in user under "browse project permission 
 # he wants to exclude a group from this project

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

We can currently create a new group and add all the users to this group except the user to which we do not want to give access to and assign the newly created group to the browse project permission.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is currently not possible to manually clear cookies in the Jira Server mobile app. In the event that a bad cookie is preserved in the app, the only way to clear it is to uninstall/delete the app and re-download/install. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a manual way to clear the app cookies. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Uninstall/reinstall the mobile app.
fields.summary: Provide a method to clear Jira Server Mobile iOS app cookies

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira 8.7 introduces [Anonymizing users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver087/anonymizing-users-998871741.html] where admins can anonymize specific users.

In some Jira instances where there are a large number of issues & customfields, the anonymizing user can be slow. This is due to the query executed by the anonymized user function is slow. 


h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the query used by the anonymized user function to allow the anonymize function to complete faster.


h3. Workaround 

None.
fields.summary: Improve User Anonymize Feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira allows you to upload attachments that contain wiki markup characters such as curly brackets. However, you won't be able to embed these attachments in a comment, rather a broken thumbnail is displayed.

You can't also embed these attachments without a thumbnail and make them available to download, because this also doesn't work.

You can't edit comments which contain such formatting because it breaks the editor, for example, with the following wiki markup formatting:
{code}
 [^{4CD97661-BC03-4D27-9313-F433D4D88DFF}.jpeg]
{code}

Breaks the editor when trying to edit with the following error:

 !Screen Shot 2020-07-02 at 13.09.21.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload an attachment with a name such as {attachment}.jpg
 # Try embedding that file as an attachment, such as a thumbnail for images or an attachment to be downloaded

h3. Expected Results

Jira behaves consistently and properly parses the file's name, escaping any wiki markup characters from it. Or, prevents the upload of those files initially with a warning about the problem.

h3. Actual Results

Jira allows you to upload the files but the editor doesn't it, so this causes frustration to the user that initially doesn't understand that the problem is due to the special characters, as there is no clear error message.

h3. Workaround

No workaround available, except from not uploading files with these characters to Jira.
fields.summary: Jira behaviour is inconsistent when the attachment name contains curly brackets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers using Postgres 10.13 trying to remove custom fields encounter an error:

Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE FROM public.customfieldvalue WHERE CUSTOMFIELD=? (ERROR: operator does not exist: character varying = bigint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user writes JQL queries via Jira's Advanced Search, certain fields support autocompletion, which will suggest values as the user types.

As the user types, Jira will use a thread to perform a search against what they've typed and return possible results back to the user. In large or slow instances, and depending on the field being autocompleted, this functionality may not return quickly, and can take multiple seconds.

It is possible for the user to continue typing and end up making multiple autocompletion requests before the previous requests ever complete and return to the user. Jira will not cancel or otherwise terminate previously ongoing autocompletion threads in this case.
h3. Performance implication

The implementation of this suggestion can be used as a workaround for any potential performance bug associated with JQL suggestions REST calls.
 One such example is JSWSERVER-20272 but there might be others.

Another workaround can include disabling *JQL Auto-complete* per *Administration >> System >> General Configuration*
h3. Suggested customization
 * Provide a parameter to customize how much to wait for new keystrokes.
 * Provide a parameter to customize the number of characters to be typed, after which the suggestions kick in. By default, we start suggesting as soon as we type.
fields.summary: Provide a way to configure the frequency at which JQL autocomplete suggestions may submit search requests.

fields.description:
Step to reproduce:

Pre-condition: In create screen or transition screen, add 'Linked issue' to the screen. 
 # Try to link issues by using issue selector. 
 #  There are two options: "Recent issue" or " From filter"
 # Choose either option and click 'Select multiple issues' button. 

Expected result: 
 # There is a 'select all' icon or checkbox

Actual result:
 * User has to check the issues one by one. If there are many issues to be selected, this could be extremely tedious tasks.

 

If the behavior is same as user links issues from more --> link --> advanced search, that would be great.
fields.summary: Jira filter should behave same in different screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Workload Pie Chart shows a warning about no work logged on issues even when the work is logged and chart is displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter with some issues that do not have work logged.
 # Now try adding this filter to Workload Pie Chart and try to save the filter.
 # There will be a warning shown about no work logged on issues which is expected.
 # Now try logging work on the issues in the filter and save the Workload Pie Chart again.
 # The Workload Pie Chart is correctly displayed but the warning is still shown.

h3. Expected Results
The Workload Pie Chart should be displayed without any warning when the work is logged on issues in the filter.

h3. Actual Results
The Workload Pie Chart shows warning even when the work is logged on issues in the filter.


h3. Workaround
Click on the edit again for Workload Pie Chart gadget and save the settings which certainly refreshes the data and the warning is gone automatically.
fields.summary: Workload Pie Chart shows a warning about no work logged on issues even when the work is logged and chart is displayed.

JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS=""

if [ "$JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS != "" ]; then

fi
{code}
2. example
{code:java}
JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY="384m"

{code}

{code:java}
if [ "$JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY != "" ]; then

fi

if [ "$JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY != "" ]; then
    JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY="2048m"
fi{code}
some more examples ( user.sh )

 

Benefit:

If you setup the enviroment from systemd then you don't need change the files on update.

Could you check Confluence, too ?

Bitbucket still work with the enviroment.

Best regards

Fabian

Would it be possible to have a custom resolution time chart where the create date and resolved date are custom fields?

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating linked issue using 'Create linked issue', the new issue created using this option, the estimated & remaining time are copied from the original issue
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira 8.4.2 with Service Desk 4.4.2
 # Create a Service Desk project
 # Ensure Time tracking is configured on the screen
 # Create a Parent Issue
 # Log Work and add time spent
 # Navigate to More > Create Linked Issue
 # Provide relevant details
 # The new issue gets created which copies the *Remaining* time from the original issue

h3. Expected Results
 - New issue should have an option to configure Time and should not copy the remaining time from original issue

h3. Actual Results
 - New issue gets created with remaining time from original issue which impact estimates for linked issue
 - Original issue:
 !OriginalIssue_1.png|thumbnail! 
 - Linked Issue:
 !LinkedIssue_1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 # Create a new issue and then link it to the original issue
fields.summary: On 'Create Linked Issue' Remaining time from Source Issue is copied as Estimated time

fields.description:
Originally raised as https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ATST-998

*Problem Definition*
When installing JIRA against MySQL 5.7, the MySQL server default collation must be set to utf8mb4_bin.  Otherwise, JIRA will not even start.  In Confluence, there is an option to set the connectionCollation option in the JDBC connection string so that the MySQL server default can remain something else (if already used by another application):
https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-fix-the-collation-and-character-set-of-a-mysql-database-744326173.html

Server character set considerations for Confluence
If you want to use utf8mb4, and character_set_server  is not set to utf8mb4  in the my.cnf  or my.ini  file on your MySQL Server and you can't change this (for example utf8 is required for a database used by another application) you will need to add the connectionCollation=utf8mb4_bin parameter to your connection URL in order to use utf8mb4. See the Connector/J 8.0 or Connector/J 5.1 documentation for more information. 

Suggested Solution
Check the connection string for 'connectionCollation' option during JIRA startup.

Workaround 
:cross_mark: ​No current workaround.  Set the MySQL server default collation
fields.summary: Database Collation health check in JIRA for MySQL should check connection string for 'connectionCollation' option at startup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In *Administration >> System >> General Configuration >> Advanced Settings*, the *jira.search.views.max.limit* setting contains the following description:
{quote}This number sets the absolute limit on the number of issues that can be exported from search results. Users trying to request more get a 403 (Forbidden) HTTP error code. To disable, set to '-1'. After changing it, update the value of 'jira.search.views.default.max' to a value that is lower than or equal to this one.{quote}

Per [JRASERVER-67839 : Unable to disable the maximum limit of number of exported issues from GUI|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-67839], this is no longer the case as we explicitly do not allow for disabling this setting by design.

However, the description is still outdated, as attempting to set this value to -1 will instead cause the following error which immediately contradicts the description:
{quote}Value must be at least 0{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to *Administration >> System >> General Configuration >> Advanced Settings*

h3. Expected Results

The description for *jira.search.views.max.limit* does not contain the following sentence:
{quote}To disable, set to '-1'.{quote}

h3. Actual Results

The description contains an incorrect instruction.

h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Documentation Fix: Description for modifying jira.search.views.max.limit setting is incorrect

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Browse using mobile browser to dashboard page.

* Elements such as (More -> Projects) are visible.  
!2960x1440px.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
* Elements such as (More -> Projects) are not visible.

Temporarily switch between desktop view on the browser.

h3. Others
* Tested on Samsung S9+ (Chrome and Samsung browser).

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

com.atlassian.jira.diagnostic.connection.DiagnosticPreparedStatement which is a PreparedStatement wrapper, maintains its own list of batch queries for reporting purposes. If the same preparedStatement object is used for multiple [executeBatch()|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/sql/Statement.html#executeBatch--] calls without calling [clearBatch()|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/sql/Statement.html#clearBatch--], this list accumulates batch queries. For very large updates which use multiple batch steps (like restoring an XML backup) this may cause memory pressure and in extreme cases \{{OutOfMemoryError}}s.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

restoring an XML backup with large AO tables and using a debugger;
 # install Jira
 # create a table in JIRA database to test purposes named "AO_111111_TEST"
 # insert 6,000 rows to this test table (number must be greater than 5,000 as imported is using batches with the size of 5,000 i.e. 6,000 rows will use to batch inserts, first will insert 5,000 and second will insert remaining 1,000)
 # create an XML backup (*gg* > *Backup System*)
 # connect the server with a debugger and put breakpoints in method com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.DataImporter$BatchInserter.flush()
 # import the XML backup generated above (*gg* > *Restore System*)
 # observe in the debugger that ps.batchQueries is not reset after the first batch is executed and size exceeds 5,000 on second batch step

h3. Expected Results

calling {{executeBatch}} shall clear the batch, also on {{DiagnosticPreparedStatement}} because underlying Statement does that automatically without requiring explicit calls to {{clearBatch()}}. Hence calling {{clearBatch()}} between batch steps does not seem to be a requirement.
 Quoting [JDBC 3.0 Specification|http://java.cnam.fr/iagl/biblio/spec/jdbc-3_0-fr-spec.pdf] 15.1.2
{quote}Calling the method executeBatch closes the calling Statement object’s current
 result set if one is open. The statement’s batch is reset to empty once
 executeBatch returns.
{quote}
h3. Actual Results

{{executeBatch()}} does not clear the batch on {{DiagnosticPreparedStatement}}. 
 Even if SQL works just fine, *batchQueries* list accumulates all statements for logging purposes.

In extreme cases like an XML backup importing millions of rows per table, this may lead to an OOME. Below exception is a stack trace of an OOME resulting from above on a production system importing 9 million rows in a single table. Since we accumulate the statements, on each batch step, Jira prepares a longer string concatenating them for logging.
{noformat}
2020-05-08 19:52:26,888-0400 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR doqinfraadmin 913x183x1 1mk8hdt 10.36.79.146 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

search-request-view plugins (implements {{com.atlassian.jira.plugin.searchrequestview.SearchRequestView}}) are not executed when search query contains some unicode characters.

h3. Environment
Issue appeared after Jira update to 8.5.0 -> 8.8.0, and reproducible with new *8.9.0*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create plugin with search-request-view module using SDK:
_atlas-create-jira-plugin-module > .. > "17. Search Request View"_
 # package and install on Jira
 # in Jira, perform search for issue, where query contains some non-ascii character. For example: *summary ~ "Über"*
 # Execute plugin by calling option Export -> MyPlugin

 
h3. Expected Results
plugin writeSearchResults() method to be executed

h3. Actual Results
* error page with text: "_HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request. Error in the JQL Query: The character 'U+009C' on line 1 at position 13 must be escaped. Use the escape '\u009c' instead. (line 1, character 13)_".

* None of plugin class methods is invoked, as error page seems to be rendered earlier.


h3. Note 
native export functions work without issues, but they seems don't implement {{com.atlassian.jira.plugin.searchrequestview.SearchRequestView}} and called differently than user-plugins.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: search-request-view plugins (implements com.atlassian.jira.plugin.searchrequestview.SearchRequestView) are not executed when search query contains some unicode characters.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the [Managing shared dashboards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-shared-dashboards-938847879.html] documentation, it indicates that shared dashboards can only be edited by the owner:
{quote}
A shared dashboard can only be edited by the shared dashboard's owner. The owner of a shared dashboard can only modify that dashboard's shares and gadgets too.
{quote} 

However, it appears we released the feature under [JRASERVER-17783|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17783]:
{quote}
We’re glad to announce that starting with Jira Server 7.12 (released today) you can grant edit rights for filters and dashboards so that teams can keep them up-to-date without unnecessary delays.
{quote}
Can the description be updated to indicate permissions can be edited in the filter and dashboard edit screens respectively, where you can choose view or edit rights for your team members.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Review the [Managing shared dashboards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/managing-shared-dashboards-938847879.html] documentation.

h3. Expected Results
The documentation indicates this new feature.
h3. Actual Results
The documentation does not currently outline the ability to grant edit permissions.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Update documentation to include edit permissions for shared dashboards

The Advanced Field should get some drop-down menu to show the users that there are more options they don't see right now.

When users are sent a link to a dashboard (i.e. [https://something.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=13179\|https://something.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=13179]) or other page in Jira (and Jira is not active or open), the attached error message appears:
{panel:bgColor=#ffebe6}
The dashboard you requested either does not exist or you don't have access to it.

Perhaps you need to [log in|http://something:com/login.jsp?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa%3FselectPageId%3D13179] to see the page.

The recently [disclosed vulnerability regarding Tomcat|https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9484] affects the following versions:

    Apache Tomcat 7x <7.0.103
    Apache Tomcat 8x <8.5.54

We should bundle a more recent version of Tomcat, so that Jira is not affected by this in the future.

h3. Expected Results

* Not applicable.

Thank you

fields.description:
To support requirements development authoring in Confluence and requirements tracking in Jira, please add the ability for a Jira ticket to watch a linked Confluence page.

Currently, a user may watch a Confluence page and receive notifications showing the delta between 2 versions of the page.  Request is for that same notification to be sent to the linked Jira record and added as a comment.  This provides users who are tracking a Jira requirements record the ability to quickly see what has changed in the linked Confluence page +from within the Jira ticket itself+.

This functionality provides a +complete requirements management solution for Atlassian+:
 * Early authoring / designing of requirements in Confluence with review workflow
 * Transition to Jira for requirements tracking / implementation
 * Record of changes made to the linked Confluence page that can be seen in the Jira record's comments
fields.summary: Allow Jira Ticket to Watch a Linked Confluence Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When updating a user name in Jira such as naming a user in an LDAP as the same username as an internal user, this can cause some undesirable behavior if you choose to rename one of the users back to their previous/any other username. Similar to JRASERVER-36594.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up Jira to a connector LDAP directory.
 # Create two users, test and testtester. One in the internal and the other in the LDAP directory.
 # Rename the LDAP user to match the internal directory user. Jira will recognize this user as the same user since the name matches between directories.
 # Rename the LDAP user back to their previous username(testtester) or any other username.

h3. Expected Results

This will update the current record inside of Jira's {{app_user}} table so it recognizes the user as its previous user.
h3. Actual Results

When you change the user back to their old username in LDAP so they don't match the internal users username, Jira creates an {{app_user}} record for a brand new user and then renames the historical record of the user name with a #1 behind it but nothing gets added to {{cwd_user}} so the relationship ends up being broken.

*Before Test*

*app_user* table:
{code:java}
j890=# select * from app_user;
  id   |   user_key    | lower_user_name 
-------+---------------+-----------------
 10000 | JIRAUSER10000 | admin
 10100 | JIRAUSER10100 | java
 10101 | JIRAUSER10101 | test
 10102 | JIRAUSER10102 | testtester
(4 rows)
{code}
*After Test*

*app_user* table:
{code:java}
j890=# select * from app_user;
  id   |   user_key    | lower_user_name 
-------+---------------+-----------------
 10000 | JIRAUSER10000 | admin
 10100 | JIRAUSER10100 | java
 10101 | JIRAUSER10101 | test
 10102 | JIRAUSER10102 | testtester#1
 10103 | JIRAUSER10103 | testtester
{code}

h3. Notes

This causes some undesirable behavior where the old user record cannot be interacted with in the GUI if they were an assignee of an issue before the username change. Example:

!Screen Shot 2020-06-24 at 9.36.14 AM.png!

Here, we can see the broken Assignee record in the JQL results. This user can be changed as the assignee but this shows the broken relationship between what's in the GUI compared to what's in the database since the link for the user between {{app_user}} and {{cwd_user}} gets broken.

h3. Workaround

If you plan to rename an LDAP user to an existing user_name of the internal directory, the following steps can avoid this behavior:
# Disable the LDAP directory;
# Move the internal directory to the top of the list;
# Rename the internal users to something different;
# Rename the LDAP users to the target username;
# Enable the directory and move it back to the top of the list.
fields.summary: Strange behavior when updating usernames in Jira

Testing the {{server-info}} endpoint via {{curl}} reveals:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

To be optimized, a custom field must have a global context and be used in *several projects only*. A good practice is for the field to be used in fewer than 10 projects. Otherwise, it's considered an actual global custom field, and you shouldn't change its configuration. So the custom field which is associated with all the issue type and all global projects having a data consistency issue but this functionality is present in Jira by design.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a  custom field with a global context 
 # Go to Custom fields optimizer and Scan for the custom field to be optimized 
 # Once the scan is complete, look for the custom field to be optimized with a global context 
 # Once you select and change the context, it throws a pop, this change won't affect the values stored in your custom filled.
 # Whereas it removed the Default configuration configured but If you prefer the pop message before proceeding the context, it is not throwing any warning to the user for any changes. Please refer the Kb article 
 # [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/optimizing-custom-fields-956713279.html]

h3. Workaround

To be optimized, a custom field must have a global context and be used in *several projects only*.

We need to make the user notified for the exact change for the global context custom field, as its result for data loss or discrepancy 

We have made the screen recording for the steps replication, which is also attached in a feature request. 

It is not throwing any warning to the user for any changes. Please refer the Kb article [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/optimizing-custom-fields-956713279.html]
fields.summary: Optimizing custom fields, it temper the default configuration scheme for custom field with global context

fields.description:
*Problem*
 As a Jira Admin, we do need that all pages provide the X-AUSERNAME header so we can always identify the user that submitted the request.

Multiple Jira pages do no provide the X-AUSERNAME header and this behavior can be observed even on older Jira versions.
 We do not use the GDPR strict mode enabled.

Some pages where the x-ausername does not show:
 * JSW Issues filter - [http://localhost:8080/projects/SCRUM/issues/SCRUM-1?filter=allopenissues]
 * JSD Queues - [http://localhost:8080/projects/ITSD/queues/custom/65]
 * JSD Issue View - [http://localhost:8080/projects/ITSD/queues/custom/65/ITSD-60]

But on most other pages (Dashboards, Addons, Admin, Issue View etc) - the x-ausername hearer shows as expected like:
 * [http://localhost:8080/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=all]
 * [http://localhost:8080/browse/SCRUM-1]
 * https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70172

 

*Business Justification*
 To effectively monitor/manage our environment, we have the logs from all our application nodes. One of the key pieces of information is the user who made the request as this helps us looks for abuse patterns, helps encourage more efficient use of the platform etc.

Affected Version: 7.0.2, 7.13.8, 8.5.4, 8.5.5
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin, we do need that all pages provide the X-AUSERNAME header

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are cases where base64 code is needed to be sent as a URL argument on the JIRA webhook so that JIRA can authentic to the recipient webhook server. Special characters on these URL arguments are not sent out properly from JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a webhook in JIRA
- Specify a URL argument containing special characters. (i.e. {{code=asdasohdoasdoasd==}})
- Trigger the event

h3. Expected Results

Special characters should be sent as part of the URL arguments.

h3. Actual Results

|Format|Webhook|URL Received|
|Plain Text|https://www.webhhook_server.com/endpoint?code=asdasohdoasdoasd==&test=test|POST /endpoint?code=asdasohdoasdoasd&test=test&user_id=admin&user_key=admin|
|URL Encoded|https://www.webhhook_server.com/endpoint?code=asdasohdoasdoasd%3D%3D|POST /endpoint?code=asdasohdoasdoasd%253D%253D&user_id=admin&user_key=admin|

h3. Notes

(!) This can happen more frequently with endpoints generated on Azure. Usually, the generated endpoint will end with double equal signs, which are removed when the webhook is fired by JIRA. 

h3. Workaround

* This workaround already worked for a few customers affected by the BUG, it consists in trying to generate another *authorization key* in the Azure side making sure that it doesn't contain any special characters.
fields.summary: Webhook calls fail if destination URL contains special characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Story with status "done" and with all subtasks also "done" is showing the "move to done" button when the fix version is part of the filter used.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project area SCRUM
# Create a story and a subtask.
# Define 2 releases: release1 already released, release2 unreleased
# Create a new board "unreleased" for project area SCRUM using the filter:
{code}
project = SCRUM AND fixVersion not in releasedVersions() ORDER BY Rank ASC 
{code}
# Set both story and subtask to release2
# Open the default board and observe the results: Story and subtask listed, no "move to done" button presented.
# Open the board "unreleased" and observe the results: Story and subtask listed, no "move to done" button presented.
# Now, change the story to release1 
# Refresh the default board and observe the results: Story and subtask listed, no "move to done" button presented.
# Refresh the board "unreleased" and observe the results

h3. Expected Results
Story and subtask listed, no "move to done" button presented.

h3. Actual Results
Story and subtask listed but the button "move to done" is presented.

h3. Workaround
* Remove the fixversion from the filter
or
* Set fixversion to a released version, thus both story and subtask will not more be presented at the board
fields.summary: Scrum board showing move to done button when filtering by fix version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While uploading an attachment during issue creation as an anonymous user throws an error saying "You are not authorized, the session has expired or connection is lost" though the "Browse Project", "create issues" and "create attachments" permissions to "Anyone on the web" group was given to "Anyone on the web".

Note: (i) This was working till 8.7.0 without issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Choose a project
 # Goto Project settings > Permissions and click on "Edit permissions"
 # Grant "Browse Project", "create issues" and "create attachments" permissions to "Anyone on the web" under group permissions.
 # Try to access the project as an anonymous user it works, try to create an issue without an attachment it works (/)
 #* However, if you try to upload an attachment issue creation fails with an error saying "You are not authorized, the session has expired or connection is lost" (x)

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be created without any errors
h3. Actual Results

The issue creation fails with an error saying "{color:#FF0000}You are not authorized, the session has expired or connection is lost"{color}
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, we can add attachments using REST API as through GUI it's not working.
{code:java}
curl -D- -u {username}:{password} -X POST -H "X-Atlassian-Token: nocheck" -F "file=@{path/to/file}" http://{base-url}/rest/api/2/issue/{issue-key}/attachments
{code}
{quote}As the anonymous users will not have any user ID & password we tried to remove -u\{username}:\{password} and ran the command like below and it works(y)
{quote}
*Example*:
{code:java}
curl -D- -X POST -H "X-Atlassian-Token: no-check" -F "file=@/Users/dgedda/Desktop/Screenshot 2020-06-18 at 8.12.48 PM.png" http://localhost:8881/j881/rest/api/2/issue/TEST-1/attachments{code}
(i) For more information, please go through our documentation for [How to add an attachment to a JIRA issue using REST API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-add-an-attachment-to-a-jira-issue-using-rest-api-699957734.html] & [Server - add attachment|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.13.0/#api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/attachments-addAttachment].
fields.summary: While uploading an attachment during issue creation as anonymous user throws an error saying "You are not authorized, the session has expired or connection is lost."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Delete sprint using REST API on a deleted board throwing error on logs

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1) Create a board
2) Create a sprint
3) Start sprint
4) Complete sprint
5) Delete the Board
6) Now try REST API call {{DELETE /rest/agile/1.0/sprint/{sprintId}} to delete the sprint
7) The sprint got deleted, with the error in log

h3. Expected Results
Sprint gets deleted without any exception/error in the log

h3. Actual Results
Sprint is getting deleted with following error in the log
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

fields.description:
The quick search component in Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.9.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.9.1
 * 8.10.0
fields.summary: XSS in Navigation - Search - CVE-2020-14169

fields.description:
The /plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest resource in Jira before version 8.7.0 allows remote attackers to access the content of internal network resources via a Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability due to a logic bug in the JiraWhitelist class.

As an example to indicate impact, when running the vulnerable version of Jira in an environment like Amazon EC2, this flaw may be used to access to a metadata resource that provides access credentials and other potentially confidential information.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.7.0

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.7.0
fields.summary: SSRF in Dashboard & Gadgets - CVE-2019-20408

fields.description:
Currently, there is no native method, setting, plugin or API call to connect Jira (Server or DC) to Google Data Studio.

We need a feature that would allow Jira data to be visualized in GDS for reporting purposes.
fields.summary: Requesting a feature to integrate Jira and Google Data Studio

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, users can only download Atlassian applications through https://www.atlassian.com/, with no option to obtain these files directly from our repositories.
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the files available on https://www.atlassian.com/ to be pulled from a repository.
fields.summary: Make Atlassian application files available in a public repository

fields.description:
The Work Description field is part of the Log Work fields and is present in the Log work screen.  However, when adding the log work field in the edit issue screen or to any transition screen, only Time Spent, Date started and Remaining Estimate are included and the Work Description field is not included. 
Kindly include the Work Description field when the Log Work field in added in the issue transition/edit screen.
fields.summary: Show the Work Description field in the edit issue/transition screen when Log Work filed is added

fields.description:
The email client in Jira Server and Data Center allows remote attackers to access outgoing emails between a Jira instance and the SMTP server via man-in-the-middle (MITM) vulnerability

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 7.13.14
 * 8.5.0 ≤ version < 8.5.5
 * 8.8.0 ≤ version < 8.8.2
 * 8.9.0 ≤ version < 8.9.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 7.13.16
 * 8.5.7
 * 8.8.2
 * 8.9.1
 * 8.10.0
fields.summary: Man-in-the-middle in Jira email client - CVE-2020-14168

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow remote attackers to impact the application's availability via a Denial of Service (DoS) vulnerability in Dashboard & Gadgets.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 7.13.14
 * 8.5.0 ≤ version < 8.5.5
 * 8.8.0 ≤ version < 8.8.2
 * 8.9.0 ≤ version < 8.9.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 7.13.14
 * 8.5.5
 * 8.8.2
 * 8.9.1
 * 8.10.0
fields.summary: Denial of service in Dashboard & Gadgets - CVE-2020-14167

fields.description:
As a Jira user writing automation rules

I want a rule validated prior to save

So I can create automation more effectively

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * At save, the smart value syntax is validated. Errors are shown next to the rule components.
 * At save, the rule components are validated for missing parts. Errors are shown next to the rule components.
 * Bonus: where smart values can be entered, auto-completion is provided to reduce entry errors.
 * Bonus: where null values can short-circuit smart values, warnings are shown
fields.summary: Validate automation rules before saving

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira is respecting the limit of 1000 when using BulkEdit. Running a JQL  search on the edited issue returns 1000.
 !BulkEdit2.png|thumbnail! 
 But during the BullEdit the progression screen is wrongly  showing more than 1000 issues in this case 1438 see attached screenshot 
(i) The BulkEdit functionality is not affected but it is confusing for the users

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use BulkEdit and select 1000 issues
 # Follow the BulkEdit steps
 !BulkEdit1.pmg.png|thumbnail! 
 # The progression screen show more than 1000 issues being edited 

h3. Expected Results
The BulkEdit progression screen displays  the exact number of the edited issues

h3. Actual Results
The BulkEdit progression screen display a number higher than the limit
 !Bulk-Edit-progression-screen.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: BulkEdit Progression screen showing more than the limit of 1000 issues

fields.description:
Request for Support for Azure MySQL: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/mysql/
We have customers who are utilising these databases type in Azure and it would be great if we extend out support for this.
fields.summary: Support for Azure Database for MySQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user is granted the Edit permission of a dashboard but is not in all of the groups added to the View permission, the user is not able to edit the dashboard. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 groups (GroupA and GroupB)
# Create 2 users (User1 and User2)
# Add User1 into both groups
# Add User2 into GroupB only
# Grant GroupA and GroupB as _Viewers_ in a dashboard
# Grant single user User1 and User2 as _Editors_ in the same dashboard
# Login as User1 and edit the dashboard 
# In another browser, login as User2 and edit the dashboard

h3. Expected Results
Both User1 and User2 are able to edit the dashboard

h3. Actual Results
Only User1 can edit the dashboard. The Edit, Share and Delete dashboard functionality is hidden from User2

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Dashboard not editable if the user does not belongs to all the groups in the Viewers field

fields.description:
Currently Jira Service Desk and JIRA Software will not send a notification (or update) to customer when a comment on a case is converted from Internal to Public (even when "Share with customer" button is clicked)

This feature request is to add an option to forcefully share a notification with customer when comment is changed from Internal to public.

*Suggestions:*
 # Add "Force customer notification" checkbox next to "Share with customer" button on a comment or even better;
# Add additional dialog box when comment is converted from internal to public with Yes or No and checkbox "Force notification";
# A global setting "Send notification to customers when internal comment is converted to public)"

*Workaround*
Copy your draft/internal comment into a new comment and share it with the Customer.
fields.summary: Force customer notification when converting internal comment to Public

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading Jira from 7.x to 8.x, the error {{No ObjectCodec defined for the generator}} is thrown on various functions.

The error appears to be because Jackson is being passed a list or set object to log, and it cannot serialize that object type.
h4. More tech details

In the examples we have encountered, {{atlassian-logging}} is passing a LinkedHashSet through to Jackson, but the version that Jira uses cannot serialize that type of object and throws an error: [https://github.com/atlassian/jackson-1/blob/master/src/java/org/codehaus/jackson/impl/JsonGeneratorBase.java#L495]

In Jira 8, the version of {{atlassian-logging}} in use was downgraded, to remove the dependency on Cloud libraries.

Seems like this might be the fix for serializing lists: [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-logging/pull-requests/54/jces-227-add-list-support-for/diff]

That fix was released in {{atlassian-logging 3.1.0}}. In Jira 8 we downgraded atlassian-logging from 3.1.4 to 2.21. Jira would previously have been able to handle list/set serializisation, but not after the downgrade.

h3. Environment
* Jira configured with Log4J Json logging format (com.atlassian.logging.log4j.layout.JsonLayout.format). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This issue is instance specific. It occurs because people have either scripts or plugins that rely on functionality that was previously available in Jira 7, but is now gone in Jira 8, due tot the downgrade of {{atlassian-logging}}. We therefore cannot provide steps to reproduce.

I do however have an internal instance where this issue can be reproduced so please reach out to me for more info.
h3. Expected Results

Functionality that worked in previous versions continues to work after upgrade.
h3. Actual Results

Various actions can fail. This is an example stacktrace that is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

h3. Workaround

If the stacktrace contains a reference to {{com.onresolve.scriptrunner}}, it's likely that you have a script being run by Scriptrunner that is expecting to be able to log a complex object type like a list/set. You should update or remove the script.

Otherwise, as the failure is logging related, you can tune the logging level for the class that caused the error so that the failing logline is no longer called.

Find and tune:
 # Get the stack trace and search for the first instance of log4j - whatever class is before that (the line underneath) is the one that called the logging.
 # Go to Admin > Logging and Profiling and set the class to a level higher than was called, ie if it called ERROR, set FATAL. You will likely need to do this from 'Configure logging level for another package.'

NB: This workaround may not work in all cases

fields.description:
h3. Description

When a user is added to a project role, when checking the Audit logs, this user is referred to by its "user key" instead of its username:
 !AuditLog_ProjectRole.png|thumbnail! 

With the recent [GDPR changes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/gdpr-changes-in-jira-975041009.html#GDPRchangesinJira-userkeys] introduced in Jira 8.4, the user keys or newly created users have the format JIRAUSERXXXXX, which makes it impossible to know which users were added to a specific role from the Audit Logs. Instead, the Jira admin user needs to have access to the DB and query the {{app_user}} table to find the relationship between the user key and the user name.

h3. Step to reproduce

# Install Jira 8.4 or any higher version
# Create a new user
# Add this user to any project role
# Go to the page ⚙ > System > Audit Logs
# Look for the entry corresponding to the addition of the user to a project role, and verify that the user key is displayed instead of the username

h3. Suggestion

Instead of using user_key, the Audit Logs should show the username as it's more relevant to the users. Note that it's already the case when a user is added to a group (as shown in the screenshot below), so the Audit Logs should be consistent and show the username whenever some modifications is made to a user.
 !AuditLog_UserManagement.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show username instead of user key in the audit logs when a user is added to a project role

fields.description: I've learned the Jira Issue macros will only return a max of 1000 rows regardless of emptying the Maximum Issues field (where it says it will return all rows if empty).  We develop Confluence dashboards that aggregate data returned in Jira Issue macros using the Pivot Table macro.  Not allowing all rows to return from queries that return more than 1000 rows results leaves Pivot Table results inaccurate.  I would like to ask for this limitation to be removed or configurable.
fields.summary: Eliminate the 1000 row return limit in the Jira Issues Macro

fields.description:
Hi there,

I know there is an issue that's been rejected before, but this is an important issue, especially in Europe (regarding GDPR and data sensitive companies / enterprises).

We have several customers who want to work with Tempo Timesheets, but they can't. Tempo has nice permissions to only allow Project Managers to see all team members' worklogs, but everyone else can still see the worklogs in Jira itself. Tempo claims this is a Jira Bug, because they don't change anything in the Jira configuration.

It would be great to have a separate permission in the permission schemes to allow only specific users to see the worklogs / other users worklogs.

In this case team members would still work on the same project, but don't see the other users worklogs. We have one customer in particular who is working in a SAFe environment and this missing feature is a showstopper (3k Data Center setup) at the moment!

Other teams have to be able to browse other teams issues, but they should not be able to see all the worklogs. Please add some permission to change this, because this is some kind of basic functionality if you want to scale and will be a showstopper for multiple customers.

Thanks a lot
Marten
fields.summary: Add "View Worklog" Permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

In attempt to mitigate the effect of implementing SameSite cookie control in Chrome browser v80, changes were done to Issue Collector in scope of this bug ticket: JRASERVER-70494.

One resulting effect of fixing the same was dropped XSRF check, which has a consequence that the session of a logged in user is not matched to the Reporter field after reporting issue via Issue Collector.

Instead, the user gets presented with a reporter email address field that will be used to match the Reporter of the issue. This makes the Issue Collector feedback a bit less efficient to collect the feedback for already logged-in users.
h3. Suggested resolution

Bring back the user-session matching functionality to the Issue Collector in Jira.
fields.summary: Revert functionality to match user session to Reporter field when providing feedback through Issue Collector

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master putting together data for the Sprint Review, I want to be able to show a burndown that shows the burndown of initial scope along with the burndown of scope creep, so that when my team finishes everything they committed to at the start of the Sprint and they Bring more work in, it communicates that we've not only met our Sprint Commitments but met them.

The chart then would show the idealized line and then the burndown of the work that was present at the start of the Sprint. When Items are brought into the Sprint, instead of a single burndown line going up, it branches and moves upward (this line would track the increase/completion of items outside of the scope of the Sprint commitment). If all outside of scope items are finished, the line merges with the burndown and goes away.
fields.summary: Add a burndown that separates scope creep from initial scope

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira server log throws "Security framework of XStream not initialized, XStream is probably vulnerable" message.

h3. Suggested Solution

Set the permissions for the XStream library when it is initialized and do not rely on the defaults. An explicit call to addPermission() would no longer log the warning.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Jira server log throws Security framework of XStream not initialized, XStream is probably vulnerable.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira 8+ does not run plugin upgrade tasks upon the first launch. After the upgrade, it requests immediate re-indexing, re-indexes the issues, but didn't schedules upgrades to run (in {{com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeScheduler}}) and didn't execute the plugin upgrade tasks. 
The job runs and reports to be finished but plugin upgrade tasks do not run. This will cause problems for plugins that have upgrade tasks (e.g Dev.Status).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Jira 7.x
# Upgrade to Jira 8.x 

h3. Expected Results
The job runs and executes the upgrade tasks.
* example for DVCS:
{noformat}
2020-01-13 18:17:00,270+0100 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.j.p.dvcs.upgrade.ServiceToHookUpgradeTask_Build01] Running upgrade to migrateHooks /services to hooks
2020-01-13 18:17:02,241+0100 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.upgrade.core.DefaultUpgradeTaskFactoryProcessor] Upgrade task [factory=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin,buildNumber=1] completed in 1971 milliseconds
...
2020-01-13 18:17:02,509+0100 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeIndexManager] Reindexing is not allowed after this upgrade and there is no immediate reindex requests
{noformat}

* and related logging for {{com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeScheduler}}
{noformat}
2020-01-13 18:17:08,486+0100 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeScheduler] Scheduling upgrades to run in 1 minute(s)
...
2020-01-13 18:18:08,494+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeScheduler] Running scheduled upgrades
2020-01-13 18:18:08,496+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.LoggingUpgradeService] run upgrades has started
2020-01-13 18:18:09,424+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.upgrade.util.BuildNumberDao] Setting current build number to 805003
2020-01-13 18:18:09,481+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeIndexManager] There are no reindex requests of type [IMMEDIATE, DELAYED] so none will be run
2020-01-13 18:18:09,481+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.upgrade.util.BuildNumberDao] Setting current version to 8.5.3
2020-01-13 18:18:09,527+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.j.upgrade.util.BuildNumberDao] Setting downgrade version to 7.1.2
2020-01-13 18:18:09,620+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.LoggingUpgradeService] run upgrades has finished successfully, and took 1124 milliseconds to process.
2020-01-13 18:18:09,620+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeScheduler] JIRA upgrades completed successfully
2020-01-13 18:18:09,626+0100 Caesium-1-3 INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeScheduler] Plugins upgrades completed successfully
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
The job runs and reports to be finished, but plugin upgrade tasks do not run
{noformat}
2020-01-13 17:09:33,198+0100 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeIndexManager] Requesting immediate reindex
2020-01-13 17:09:33,870+0100 JiraTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO anonymous     [c.a.j.index.request.DefaultReindexRequestManager] Re-indexing started
...
2020-01-13 17:10:26,462+0100 JiraTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO anonymous     [c.a.j.index.request.DefaultReindexRequestManager] Re-indexing finished
2020-01-13 17:10:26,536+0100 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.j.upgrade.util.BuildNumberDao] Setting current version to 8.5.3
2020-01-13 17:10:26,561+0100 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.j.upgrade.util.BuildNumberDao] Setting downgrade version to 7.1.2
2020-01-13 17:10:26,564+0100 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.upgrade.LoggingUpgradeService] run upgrades has finished successfully, and took 54193 milliseconds to process.
{noformat}
* {{com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeScheduler}} is not scheduled. 
 
h3. Notes
* jira.upgrade.delay.minutes default to 1

h3.Workaround
* Restart Jira. Jira will run plugin upgrade tasks after restart. 
* Trigger the delayed upgrade tasks through REST API: POST /rest/api/2/upgrade
** see https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.5.5/#api/2/upgrade-runUpgradesNow
fields.summary: Jira 8+ does not run plugin upgrade tasks after the first launch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Concurrent invocation of {{updateFieldConfigScheme}} on {{FieldConfigSchemeManager}} may cause a race condition which may result in IssueTypeScheme and PriorityScheme to revert to the default schemes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a project {{TestProject}} and assign a new IssueType and Priority scheme to this project
 # create a large number of projects (>500) using shared configuration from {{TestProject}} so that we have 500+ projects sharing the same configuration. Take care to create projects in a non-concurrent fashion (i.e. one-by-one) to not trigger the race condition.
 # create multiple new projects with the same shared configuration concurrently (in parallel).
 # notice that IssueTypeScheme and PriorityScheme for some projects may revert.

Since this is a race condition it may be possible to not trigger the behaviour described all the time so this may need a couple of trials. For recreation purposes, we can use a load testing tool like JMeter for steps (3) and (4) above. For (3) we set threadpool size to 1 to and for step (4) we set it to 5 with no ramp-up time so that we try to create 5 projects concurrently.
h3. Expected Results

All new projects created and old projects have their schemes assigned to the schemes we've created at step (1)

h3. Actual Results

For some projects, priority and/or issuetype schemes revert to default schemes.

h3. Workaround
Performing issueTypeScheme and priorityScheme changes, or operations that may trigger such changes automatically, like creating a project using shared configuration in a non-concurrent fashion (i.e. not in parallel but one action at a time)

*Note*: this bug report looks similar to [JRASERVER-66625|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-66625], however, the execution path mentioned in this ticket (see steps to reproduce on this ticket) is already fixed and does not cause this issue. 

h5. Recovering the Issue Type Scheme associations
See JSWSERVER-20581 or JRASERVER-66625 for details how to recover Scheme associations
fields.summary: Concurrent invocation of updateFieldConfigScheme on FieldConfigSchemeManager may result in IssueTypeScheme and PriorityScheme to revert to default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL does not filter issues properly with Due Date with the time zone of Baku (+4)
h3. Environment

Jira 8.5.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Please create a project and add a due date field on the issue screen.
 # Set the due date in a few of the issues.
 # Please verify and set the default user time zone to system field
 # Now especially set a due date of 31st May in of the few issues.
 # Please run the following JQL query "project = TEST AND due is not EMPTY AND due >2020-05-25 AND due < 2020-06-03"
 # The JQL will filter the desired results 
 # Now  go-> system -> advanced setting and change the time Region = Asia, Time Zone = (GMT+04:00)Baku
 # The same JQL project = TEST AND due is not EMPTY AND due >2020-05-25 AND due < 2020-06-03  seems to be skipping May 31 results 

h3. Expected Results
 * Please run the following JQL query project = TEST AND due is not EMPTY AND due >2020-05-25 AND due < 2020-06-03
 * The JQL will filter the desired results 

h3. Actual Results
 * The same JQL project = TEST AND due is not EMPTY AND due >2020-05-25 AND due < 2020-06-03  seems to be skipping May 31 results 

Notes
 JIRA Build: 8.5.1
 JIRA Installation Type: Standalone
 Java Version : 1.8.0_202 - OpenJdk
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL does not filter issues properly with Due Date with time zone of Baku (+4)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-32347].
{panel}
JIRA does not officially document the support of Maria DB, or indicate any support for this. As some major Linux distributions are moving to use MariaDB and the functionality is similar, it would be good to provide support for this Database version.
h3. Suggested Solution

Officially support MariaDB for JIRA, including adding documentation and any other articles as required.
h3. Workaround

MySQL can be installed on RHEL, Oracle Linux, CentOS and Fedora using the MySQL Yum repository, [https://dev.mysql.com/downloads/repo/yum/]. The [Quick Guide to Using the MySQL Yum Repository|https://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql-yum-repo-quick-guide/en/] walks through how to configure the repository and install MySQL.
fields.summary: Add MariaDB as a supported platform for Jira

fields.description:
Users without session information should be pushed to the login page.
 Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow remote attackers to view sensitive information via an Information Disclosure vulnerability in Login.

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 8.9.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 8.9.1
 * 8.10.0
 * 8.11.0

*Notes:*

If the fix is causing problems it can be disabled by [adding to Jira a dark feature flag|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html]
{code:java}
jira.redirect.anonymous.404.errors.disabled
{code}
The fix is available in LTS versions - 7.13.15+ and 8.5.6+ but will be disabled. The fix can be enabled by [adding to Jira a dark feature flag|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html]
{code:java}
jira.redirect.anonymous.404.errors.enabled{code}
Both feature flags can be [added by admin via site `<jira_directory>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa`|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html]
fields.summary: Information disclosure in Login - CVE-2020-4028

fields.description:
As a typical scrum master, project manager, team lead, I would like the ability to filter the results of my query in a number of ways related to Changelog History data so that I can gather and report on relevant change events, as well as develop metrics to measure and improve.

Specifically I need the ability to use JQL to filter issues by changelog history events in the following ways:
 * Changes to a specific field or list of fields (both system and custom fields; could be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields)
 * Changes made to a specific field match or are similar to <text>, e.g. ~"<text>"
 * Changes made to a specific field equal an option or comma-separated list of options for that field
 * Changes made to a specific field from one option to another option, e.g. from <option A> to <option B>
 * Changes made within certain time frames, e.g.: -1w, EndOfMonth(), before or after <date>, between date range, etc.
fields.summary: Extend JQL parameters for Changelog History

fields.description:
As a typical developer, scripter, or user of ETL (extract, transform, load) tools, I need to ability to include parameters specific to Changelog History data in the REST API call so that I can limit the volume of JSON data returned.

We are a large enterprise using the REST API to pull Jira data into Alteryx to perform ETL functions in preparation for loading the transformed data into Tableau for reporting. Currently there is a large volume of Changelog History data returned when using "...?expand=changelog". Quite often the vast majority of changelog data is not needed or wanted, so we need the ability to limit what changelog data is returned in the following ways:
 * Changes to a specific field or list of fields (both system and custom fields; could be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields)
 * Changes made to a specific field match or are similar to <text>, e.g. ~"<text>"
 * Changes made to a specific field equal an option or comma-separated list of options for that field
 * Changes made to a specific field from one option to another option, e.g. from <option A> to <option B>
 * Changes made within certain time frames, e.g.: -1w, EndOfMonth(), before or after <date>, between date range, etc.
fields.summary: Extend Jira REST API for Changelog History

fields.description:
Raising this request on behalf of my Jira users.

It has been brought up that they'd like to see a Synchrony like feature brought into Jira. In the same way that you get notified when someone has worked on a page you have open, our users would like this feature to be implemented in Jira, so if they are working on a ticket and it gets updated, they are notified of the change.

Thank you,

Cory
fields.summary: Add Synchrony Like Features to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Supported Platforms article indicates that the only supported version for several of our latest releases incorrectly states that:

* Application server
**     We support Apache Tomcat 8.5.35. 
**    We don't support deploying multiple Atlassian applications in a single Tomcat container. 

Our latest releases bundle different Apache Tomcat versions such as 8.5.40, 8.5.42, and 8.5.50.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Step 1: Access the following URL:
[Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html]
 # Step 2: Scroll down until you reach the *Application Server* section.

h3. Expected Results

The correct supported version for Apache Tomcat will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The supported version displayed appears to be the same since Jira 8.0.

h3. Workaround

You can refer to the following table for the correct information:

|| *Jira version* || *Bundled Tomcat version* ||
| 7.11.0 | Application Server Apache Tomcat/8.5.29 |
| 7.11.1 | Application Server Apache Tomcat/8.5.29 |
| 7.11.2 | Application Server Apache Tomcat/8.5.29 |
| 7.12.0 | Application Server Apache Tomcat/8.5.29 |
| 7.12.1 | Application Server Apache Tomcat/8.5.29 |
| 7.12.2 | Application Server Apache Tomcat/8.5.32 |

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When printing an issue that contains a link to a Confluence page, the link will not be included on the issue printable version.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira issue
 # Go to More > Link and add a Link to a Confluence Page
 # Save it
 # Go to Export - Word (or any Format) - Save it

h3. Expected Results

The printable version should show the Issue Links section with the page title, as it shows when the link belongs to a Jira link. Example:

!image-2020-06-10-17-09-18-438.png|width=239,height=206!
h3. Actual Results

The Issue Links page is not shown in the printable document if the link points to a Confluence page:
 !image-2020-06-10-17-10-51-372.png|width=579,height=165!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exporting a Jira ticket In any printable format does not include Links to Confluence Pages

fields.description:
A few of our teams use kanban boards to track Epics and have requested it be possible to change the colour of an epic from the kanban board much like changing it from a sprint board backlog (as shown in this image).

  !image-2020-06-05-14-27-02-654.png|width=372,height=165!

The workaround we currently have is to do a bulk change and edit the epic colour however, this has its flaws as the user needs to be aware of the names for different epic colours e.g. "ghx-label-4".

For this reason we also have removed the ability to edit the epic colour field from our screens.

We would like the epics panel added to kanban boards as well to grant users more flexibility to easily change the colour of their epics and visually see what colour they are changing to.

Implementing JSWSERVER-15793 (adding a colour panel to choose from) would also solve our problem if it was available when changing the epic colour field.
fields.summary: Add epics panel to kanban boards to allow easy Epic colour change

fields.description:
Previously the user could use HTML tags in custom field descriptions to format the descriptions. IE allow boding etc. Per JRASERVER-28776, this has been removed for security purposes. Please add text formatting to the custom field descriptions so the descriptions are easier to read and still make sense.

 

Note: I did not find any other related cr in my initial search
fields.summary: Allow text formatting in Custom Field descriptions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The {{get}} operation on a {{DeferredReplicationCachedReference}} is deferred, hence causes a new {{DeferredReplicationStrategy}} instance to be created, registered to a {{ThreadLocal}} variable and run. The execution is almost exclusively no-op, for the majority of 'get' invocations won't cause a change in the cache to be replicated, apart from the initialization of the reference on first use.

This behaviour generates unnecessary computational overhead. Caches shall be optimized for reads as much as possible; for regular 'get's (which don't generate side-effects to be replicated) we shall have a non-deferred implementation. As an example, read-only cache operations like gets are not deferred at {{DeferredReplicationCache}} instances.

In addition, in certain JVM states like defined at JRASERVER-71058, registering {{cacheReplicationStrategy}} ThreadLocal may consume very high CPU.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Reproducible always
h3. Expected Results

Read-only operations like '{{get'}} shall not trigger a replication event on {{DeferredReplicationCachedReferences}}
h3. Actual Results

{{get}} operation is deferred, hence goes through deferredReplicaction logic
h3. Notes

Example of the merged thread-dump containing {{com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCachedReference.get}}
{noformat}
"*" count=364 prio=5 tid=* nid=* *
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
100.00% [364/364]X at com.atlassian.jira.cache.DeferredReplicationCachedReference.get(DeferredReplicationCachedReference.java:28)
 57.69% [210/364]|\ at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.runDeferred(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:174)
 57.69% [210/364]| \ at java.lang.ThreadLocal.remove(ThreadLocal.java:222)
 57.69% [210/364]|  X at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.access$200(ThreadLocal.java:298)
 51.65% [188/364]|  |X at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.remove(ThreadLocal.java:499)
  2.20%   [8/364]|  ||V at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.expungeStaleEntry(ThreadLocal.java:603)
 49.45% [180/364]|  | V at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.expungeStaleEntry(ThreadLocal.java:617)
  6.04%  [22/364]|   V at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.remove(ThreadLocal.java:496)
 22.53%  [82/364]|\ at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.runDeferred(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:170)
 22.53%  [82/364]| \ at java.lang.ThreadLocal.set(ThreadLocal.java:203)
 22.53%  [82/364]|  X at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.access$100(ThreadLocal.java:298)
 21.43%  [78/364]|   V at java.lang.ThreadLocal$ThreadLocalMap.set(ThreadLocal.java:467)
 18.41%  [67/364] \ at com.atlassian.jira.cluster.cache.ehcache.BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.runDeferred(BlockingParallelCacheReplicator.java:172)
{noformat}
Note: 18% of snippet is actually doing {{runDeferred}}, other code is busy with *ThreadLocal* operations.

h3. Note on fix
As part of the change the following settings are obsoleted:
*  atlassian.disable.deferred.cache.replication
*  jira.cache.replication.localq.disabled

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: DeferredReplicationCachedReference 'get' operation triggers unnecessary replication events

None.

fields.description:
Issue results contain a good deal of contextual references: linked issues, sub-tasks, project, etc. However they do not contain a reference to the parent issue.

[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-issue-issueIdOrKey-get]

This omission makes it difficult to construct tree-like views on issue queries. The backing data structure clearly maintains this information, because issue queries can filter by parent ID. However, it is not possible to disambiguate the parents of multiple issues returned by the same JQL query.

The message boards are littered with requests for how to obtain the parent of an issue, with the answer invariably being run a secondary query. The limitation can be seen in Jira's own UI as the issue view slowly builds the branch structure, one parent query at a time. All of these use cases would be made much simpler and reduce API spam by adding a reference to the parent issue.
fields.summary: REST API: Return parent reference in API Issue results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Software createmeta Endpoints are missing schema details

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The documentation is available [here|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.9.0/#api/2/issue-getCreateIssueMetaFields] and [here|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.9.0/#api/2/issue-getCreateIssueMetaProjectIssueTypes].

h3. Expected Results
Much like the deprecated version of these endpoints, *{{getmeta}}*, their updated counterpart should also include the *Schema* definition.

h3. Actual Results
The schema definition is currently missing.

h3. Workaround

They are known to be a flattened version in the following structure: *{{project/items[]/issuetype/items}}* (all paged).
fields.summary: Jira Software createmeta Endpoints are missing schema details

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When installing Jira service using *Service.bat* shipped along with Jira 8.9 .zip archive for windows, there is an error witnessed stating below:
{code:java}
 [JIRA_install_dir]\atlassian\jira-software-8.9.0\bin\Tomcat8.exe.x64"' is not recognized as an internal or external command
Failed installing 'JIRASW8_9_0' service
{code}
The error is observed when executing service.bat after renaming *tomcat8.exe.x64* to *tomcat8.exe*, so service.bat was looking for the .x64 file, which didn't exist.
 When running service.bat without renaming, the command runs fine, and windows then throws the error on trying to open an .x64 file (and thus, the service isn't actually installed).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Required* 64-bit (Processor/Architecture) environment to reproduce the behavior
 # Download .zip archive for v8.9
 ** [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/binary/atlassian-jira-software-8.9.0.zip]
 # Extract the archive
 # Navigate to /bin directory and execute the service.bat install jira
 # An error is witnessed:
{panel:title=Error Witnessed after executing Service.bat|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#adcdff|bgColor=#d1e3ff}
"C:\atlassian\jira-software-8.9.0\bin\Tomcat8.exe.x64"' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
 operable program or batch file.
 Failed installing 'JIRASW8_9_0' service
{panel}

 # Error is witnessed as .x64 is not recognized executable, there are restrictions in some environment to allow only certain executables like .exe to run

h3. Expected Results
 * There should be some message to inform users that there are restriction due to which error is witnessed, so that next steps could be taken accordingly and service can be installed

h3. Actual Results
 * There is an error observed and services could not be installed

h3. Workaround

Remove below lines from service.bat:
{code:java}
IF "%PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE%"=="x86" goto notX64
set EXECUTABLE=%EXECUTABLE%.x64
{code}
Rename Tomcat8.exe.x64 to Tomcat8 and execute service.bat
fields.summary: Error when Installing Jira service using service.bat
